cells.data:
# Final information:
12 noon here in Peabody

We are turning $Y' = AY (+G)$ into $Y = S\Lambda S^{-1}Y (+G)$ by diagonalizing $A$.

Aside:
If $\Psi(0) = I$, $Y(t) = \Psi(t)Y_0 + \Psi(t)\int_0^t\Psi^{-1}(s)G(s)ds$
If not, $\matrixstart c1 \\ c2 \matrixend = \Psi^{-1}(0)Y_0$, and we replace $Y_0$ above with the $c$-matrix

Looking at Undetermined Coefficients (to avoid the messiness of integrating, like how we avoided variation of parameters with a guessing trick)

Still find homogeneous solution...
Then specific solution

Guess!
Like $Y = tu + v, (u,v \in \mathbb{R}^2)$

Plug in and start matching
